statement_text: SIC is a governance layer with constitutional axioms (A1-A17)
SIT is a transport layer with semantic folding and isolation
SIC-SIT-Protocol is a normative specification layer (RFC-style)
notes: README describes purpose but no RFC docs yet

statement_text: S★ (Semantic Stability Threshold) = 2.76
S★ is the critical point beyond which semantic drift becomes irreversible
Skeleton JSON is a structured format for capturing semantic state
Skeleton JSON has 4 required fields: entity memory state meta
Constitutional Axioms are 17 core principles (A1-A17)
Axiom A1: All security vulnerabilities are boundary failures
Axiom A2: The boundary of AI-native systems is semantic intent not data
Axiom A3: Structured semantic state is inherently sanitized
Axiom A4: AI does not prophesy decide or replace will (HALT_AND_ESCALATE)
Axiom A5: Overflow is a signal not an error
Axiom A6: Quantification is consensus
Axiom A7: Semantic consistency is the only basis for cross-model collaboration
Axiom A8: Temporal topology is the fourth dimension of semantic density
Axiom A9: Format is the boundary of protocol cannot be overwritten by content value
Axiom A10: Do not trust data trust structure
Axiom A11: Do not trust nodes trust the network
Axiom A12: Prediction is fragile chaos is robust
Axiom A13: Distributed systems have no now only causal order
Axiom A14: Honest nodes can be misjudged malicious nodes can disguise as honest
Axiom A15: Governance complexity has a phase transition critical point
Axiom A16: Security mechanisms must not sacrifice participation fairness
Axiom A17: Semantic value takes priority over computational resources
BFT (Byzantine Fault Tolerance) tolerates up to f < n/3 malicious nodes
SWAT (Semantic Weight Adjustment and Throttling) is an adaptive threshold management protocol
Semantic Folding is a compression algorithm that preserves topological structure
notes: Code exists but no experimental validation
